My Dear Child,
 
What trunk box are you talking about? You did not mention anything about a trunk box in your previous e-mail. I do hope that Sister Trumble is wrong and that you are not one of these scammers trying to obtain money from this charity.
 
I am sure you would not wish to trick The Holy Bagel Community about which I now give you some further information:
 
The Holy Bagel Community was established by Pastor Cecil Ngoblah in 1979 to cater for the material, moral and spiritual needs of young African students and workers living in Europe.  Although donations were received from several African states, the Community was beset by financial problems until 1998 when a student from Zambia - who at the time was renting a room in the Community's London hostel - won £9.5 million in the British National Lottery. 
The student  donated £1.5 million to Pastor Ngoblah and thanks to some wise investments the Community now owns hostels in London, Manchester and Paris and maintains a fund for indigents and charitable causes throughout Africa.
 
Father Charles Farnes-Barnes 
The Holy Bagel Community

We certainly do want to help you and I am sorry that your request for Father Charles Farnes-Barnes ID was not understood. 
   
Now we do not know when the good Father will return from Haiti but I must inform you that even if he were here in the United Kingdom, it would not be possible to send you his ID. This is because members of The Holy Bagel Community work under strict anonymity.  
 
However, the Holy Bagel Community possesses consultative status at UNESCO  and Father Charles possesses a United Nations laissez-passer card. If you quote the following reference to the courier company: UNESCO 895627/FU/99/HBC/2 this should be sufficient to confirm his identity. This reference is ceteris paribus and is in full compliance with the vas deferens paragraphs in Chapters 19 and 20 of the United Nations International Travel Regulations 1988.  
 
 
No further action is needed by the courier company as Father Charles has authorised me to give you this reference which should of course be treated in strict confidence.  
 
 
I do hope this will enable you to proceed with our business.  
 
 
As we say in my native country of Smegaroon, Geharget zolst du veren,  
 
 
Sister Nelda
